alert.note: Alert for Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 8:04PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Rock Island, Scott, Clinton, southwestern Jackson, northern Muscatine, Cedar, southeastern Jones and southeastern Johnson Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 804 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Wyoming to near Tipton to near West Liberty. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Maquoketa, Tipton, West Branch, Durant, Stanwood, Eldridge, DeWitt, West Liberty, Wilton, Walcott, Blue Grass, Buffalo, Andalusia, Long Grove, Lowden, Wheatland, Grand Mound, Delmar, and Wyoming. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa near mile marker 1. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 256 and 299. Interstate 280 between mile markers 1 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
